intro: Cacalia reflexa, commonly known as the bentleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are bell-shaped, usually blue to purple in color, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cacalia reflexa is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
